# survnip

<!-- badges: start -->
[![R build status](https://github.com/EmilHvitfeldt/survnip/workflows/R-CMD-check/badge.svg)](https://github.com/EmilHvitfeldt/survnip/actions)
[![Codecov test coverage](https://codecov.io/gh/EmilHvitfeldt/survnip/branch/master/graph/badge.svg)](https://codecov.io/gh/EmilHvitfeldt/survnip?branch=master)

[![Lifecycle: experimental](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://www.tidyverse.org/lifecycle/#experimental)
<!-- badges: end -->

`survnip` is a "`parsnip`-adjacent" packages with model definitions for survival analysis packages.

## Installation

And the development version from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("EmilHvitfeldt/survnip")
```


## Example

```{r example}
library(survnip)
library(survival)

cox_mod <-
  cox_reg() %>%
  set_engine("survival") %>%
  fit(Surv(time, status) ~ age + ph.ecog, data = lung)

predict(cox_mod, new_data = lung, .time = 200)

predict(cox_mod, new_data = lung, type = "time", .time = 200)

predict(cox_mod, new_data = lung, type = "survival", .time = 200)
```
